channel.title: Projects on Aman Sharma
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Aman Sharma

item.title: About Aman
item.description: About Me Hello, welcome to my portfolio website. My name is Aman, a 22 year old British MFA student at London Business School. Below is a high level overview of my background: Nationality: British Where I have lived: Maidenhead (a town 30 miles West of London) from ages 0-18 and then London since starting my undergraduate degree! Yes, I know I am a very global citizen at this point(!

item.title: Airbnb Analysis: Singapore
item.description: Executive Summary The given data set allowed us to explore the Airbnb in Singapore and its special characteristics in detail. In order to derive meaningful statements in a comprehensive way we performed various operations in the beginning. These measures included the elimination of columns not related to our desired outcome, transformation of columns into workable data, elimination of extreme outliers as well as the creation of new columns.

item.title: Analysing the US Treasury Yield Curve
item.description: US Treasury Yield Curve Analysis Prior to 2020, the last 7 macroeconomic recessions were preceeded by an inversion of the US government yield curve. We are going to investigate this. First, we use the tidyquant package to download monthly rates for different durations. # Get a list of FRED codes for US rates and US yield curve; choose monthly frequency # to see, eg., the 3-month T-bill https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/TB3MS tickers <- c('TB3MS', # 3-month Treasury bill (or T-bill) 'TB6MS', # 6-month 'GS1', # 1-year 'GS2', # 2-year, etc.

item.title: Omega plc's Gender Pay Gap
item.description: Omega Group plc- Pay Discrimination Scenario: A sample of 50 employees (24 men, 26 women) at Omega Group Plc showed a 8,700 difference in average salary for men compared to women. We are going to investigate whether this marked difference is indeed significant and whether there is an observable factor (such as experience) that could explain the difference. Loading the data omega <- read_csv(here::here("data", "omega.csv")) glimpse(omega) # examine the data frame ## Rows: 50 ## Columns: 3 ## $ salary <dbl> 81894, 69517, 68589, 74881, 65598, 76840, 78800, 70033, .

item.title: Project 2
item.description: Where Do People Drink The Most Beer, Wine And Spirits? For this project I am going to analyse which countries consume the most of different types of alcoholic beverages Loading and exploring the data library(fivethirtyeight) data(drinks) We have one column with character data which contains country names and four columns with numerical data which contains the amount of each type of alcohol consumed in these countries. There are no missing variables.

item.title: Project 3
item.description: Returns of FAANG stocks In this project we are going to explore the performance of FAANG Stocks (Facebook, Amazon, Apple, Netflix and Google) that have earned their notoriety by taking the stock market by storm and rapidly rising to become the most valuable companies out there, with no sign of slowing down. Loading the dataset #Loading the NYSE dataset nyse <- read_csv(here::here("data","nyse.csv")) nyse %>% glimpse %>% skim ## Rows: 508 ## Columns: 6 ## $ symbol <chr> "MMM", "ABB", "ABT", "ABBV", "ACN", "AAP", "AFL", "A".

item.title: Project 4
item.description: Analysis Trumpâ€™s Approval In this project we will be analysing polls to better understand how sentiment changes for President Trump over time. # Import approval polls data approval_polllist <- read_csv(here::here('data', 'approval_polllist.csv')) glimpse(approval_polllist) ## Rows: 15,619 ## Columns: 22 ## $ president <chr> "Donald Trump", "Donald Trump", "Donald Trump",... ## $ subgroup <chr> "All polls", "All polls", "All polls", "All pol... ## $ modeldate <chr> "9/27/2020", "9/27/2020", "9/27/2020", "9/27/20... ## $ startdate <chr> "1/20/2017", "1/20/2017", "1/20/2017", "1/21/20.
